title: IHC and RIQ Strategic 10-year Reinsurance Partnership
description: IHC and RIQ announced a strategic 10-year alliance targeting over USD 500 million in reinsurance premiums through AI-native risk transfer solutions tailored to IHC and its group companies. The partnership aims to enhance Abu Dhabi's position as a global hub for reinsurance and intelligent risk management. RIQ, launched by IHC in partnership with BlackRock and Lunate, will deliver advanced reinsurance solutions leveraging AI-augmented underwriting and data modeling. The partnership includes plans for regulatory authorization by ADGM's FSRA and will enable IHC to deploy intelligent capital to increase resilience and agility across its portfolio.
source_name: IHC and RIQ Announce Strategic 10-year Alliance Anchored by Over USD 500 Million in Reinsurance Premiums

opportunities.title: AI System Integration for Data-Driven Underwriting
opportunities.description: Companies specializing in AI and data analytics can partner with IHC-RIQ to provide advanced data ingestion and cleansing systems, or to develop machine learning tools that enhance underwriting models beyond the existing ecosystem. This would increase accuracy of risk assessments and enable new classes of reinsurance products tailored to untapped markets.
roadmap_steps: Research IHC-RIQ's existing technical stack and AI models
Identify compatibility and potential areas of improvement in underwriting workflows
Develop a proposal or proof-of-concept for AI-driven risk modeling enhancements
Approach IHC-RIQ with a demo and partnership request
Negotiate integration and deployment roadmaps

opportunities.title: Regulatory Technology Solutions for ADGM Compliance
opportunities.description: Regtech companies can collaborate with IHC-RIQ to automate compliance and reporting processes required by the Financial Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA) of ADGM. This streamlines onboarding and ongoing regulatory obligations for the reinsurance business while lowering operational risk and legal exposure.
roadmap_steps: Gather detailed information on FSRA and ADGM compliance requirements
Develop compliance automation prototype integrating with IHC-RIQ systems
Engage IHC-RIQ's compliance and legal team for a pilot project
Validate the tool’s impact on operations
Formalize long-term regtech partnership

opportunities.title: Third-Party Risk Data Enrichment Partnerships
opportunities.description: Data vendors (such as those specializing in climate, cyber, or health risk data) can establish data throughput agreements with IHC-RIQ to enrich their risk engine with new data sources, providing more granular risk modeling and enabling innovative reinsurance products.
roadmap_steps: Identify data categories underrepresented in IHC-RIQ's risk models
Develop datasets or APIs compatible with AI-native underwriting platforms
Initiate dialogue with IHC-RIQ risk and data teams
Pilot integration of enriched datasets into underwriting process
Negotiate ongoing data supply agreement

opportunities.title: White-Label Solutions for Regional Insurers
opportunities.description: Technology firms can offer white-labeling and customization of IHC-RIQ’s AI-powered reinsurance products for regional (non-group) insurers, enabling rapid digital transformation and more competitive insurance offerings in emerging Middle Eastern and African markets.
roadmap_steps: Assess demand and technological readiness among regional insurers
Develop a white-label SaaS version of reinsurance solutions
Partner with IHC-RIQ to engineer suitable APIs/interfaces for external clients
Co-market and onboard pilot insurers
Scale support and integration teams

opportunities.title: Capital Market Access for Alternative Risk Transfer
opportunities.description: Investment platforms or capital market service providers can work with IHC-RIQ to structure and list insurance-linked securities (ILS), such as catastrophe bonds or sidecars, providing alternative capital sources for risk transfer and expanding investor access to diversified reinsurance-linked assets.
roadmap_steps: Research regulatory requirements for ILS issuance in ADGM
Develop frameworks for risk transfer between IHC-RIQ and capital market investors
Coordinate with IHC-RIQ on structuring the first ILS product
Engage institutional investors for pilot issuance
Optimize issuance platform and expand product range
